answers.answer: This does not appear to be due to a thyroid problem and it is unlikely that thyroid medication will help with weight loss.  Would complete the thyroid evaluation by looking at T3 levels to make sure these are normal -- if so, move on to other possible reasons for these symptoms such as fluid retention, steroid excess (medication or adrenal-over production), insulin resistance (pre-diabetes), etc.

question: Hi there,i had a sudden weight gain over about a month or so ( i am not overweight) and went to get tested and had a marginally low T4 (TSH) level of 1.23. my doctor said it was fine but me not wanting to leave the house b/c none of my clothes fit  wanted something that may help me  so he put me on levothyroxine 25 mcg -1 a day.. ( I work out regularly and eat really well) I am hungry all the time! I cant be satiated no matter what i eat? i phyiscally know i am full but still have hunger? i have actually gained weight being on it. i know its a low dose so i'm confused at what to do> to double the amount i take to get the affects of controlling my thyroid, but will i be even more famished?or to change to a different type of medicine?Help,paige
title: hypothyroid medicine
